cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast then east, skirting the North Carolina Outer Banks before turning out to sea
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: no direct landfall – closest coastal approach near Cape Hatteras, NC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC; Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC; Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of Georgia, South Carolina, and especially North Carolina Outer Banks; swells along the entire southeast U.S. shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible as outer fringe passes well offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – only elevated surf and rip currents expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Light, brief showers possible; totals generally under 1 inch
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along northeast Florida beaches through Monday
